value: is only a 500m walk. The climb up to Old Shey Palace will be rewarded with a fantastic view on one of the most beautiful landscapes of Ladakh.
is about 4 km down the road towards the famous Hemis Monastery. The monasteries Stakna, Stok and Matho as well as Indus River are in visual range.

is located in Shey the ancient capital of Ladakh. The small rural village is located 15 km south-east of the busy capital Leh. The village is surrounded by spectacular mountains. The rooms are very cozy. Prices (incl. breakfast and dinner) are between 500 and 700 Rs per night/person. Email: info@ladakhguesthouse.com

- Getting to Leh is very easy and a great possibility to experience the Ladakhi transportation system. Just stand by the main road and wave your hand if you see a small Suzuki van (the vans look like small boxes). The ride to Leh takes about 20 minutes and costs 20 rupees.
